messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web backend projects. Your task is to examine a specific web backend project, identify its primary programming language and primary development framework. I'll provide you the output of the `ls` command, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

```
app
docker-compose.yml
docker-deploy.sh
Dockerfile
gunicorn.conf.py
LICENSE
pyproject.toml
README.md
requirements.txt
starter.py
tests
uv.lock
```

{'stdout': '[project]
name = "app"
version = "0.6"
description = "ðŸŽ€A simple and practical CMS implememted by flask"
requires-python = ">=3.9,<3.14"
authors = [
    {name = "sunlin92", email = "sun.melodies@gmail.com"}
]
dependencies = [
    "Flask==3.1.0",
    "Flask-JWT-Extended==4.7.1",
    "Flask-SQLAlchemy==3.1.1",
    "WTForms==3.2.1",
    "tablib==3.8.0",
    "spectree==1.4.5",
    "pillow>=11.1.0",
    "flask-cors>=5.0.1",
    "gunicorn>=23.0.0",
    "gevent>=24.1.1",
    "flask-socketio>=5.5.1",
    "blinker>=1.9.0",
    "python-dotenv>=1.0.1",
    "gevent-websocket>=0.10.1",
    "pydantic[email]>=1.10.21,<2.0.0",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "black>=25.1.0",
    "isort>=6.0.1",
    "watchdog>=6.0.0",
    "coverage>=7.6.12",
    "pytest>=8.3.5",
    "pre-commit>=4.1.0",
    "pytest-order>=1.3.0",
    "flake8>=7.1.2",
    "mypy>=1.15.0",
]

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[[tool.poetry.source]]
name = "tsinghua"
url = "https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/pypi/web/simple/"
priority = "primary"

[tool.isort]
multi_line_output = 3
force_grid_wrap = 0
line_length = 120
use_parentheses = true
include_trailing_comma = true

[tool.black]
line_length = 120

[tool.mypy]
files = ["starter.py"]
ignore_missing_imports = true

[tool.pytest]
testpaths = ["tests"]
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- Primary programming language: Python
- Primary development framework: Flask (Flask v3.1.0)

Explanation / evidence:
- pyproject.toml lists Flask and many Flask extensions in dependencies (e.g., "Flask==3.1.0", "Flask-SQLAlchemy", "flask-cors", "flask-jwt-extended", "flask-socketio").
- requirements.txt contains "flask==3.1.0" and other Flask-related packages.
- starter.py imports create_app from the app package and uses Flask constructs: app = create_app(...), @app.route(...) and app.run(), which are idiomatic Flask usage.
- The repository layout includes an app package with api, model, schema, etc., and there is a gunicorn.conf.py (typical for deploying Flask WSGI apps).

Taken together these show this is a Python web backend built primarily with the Flask framework.
